thread.title: Beware the karaka berry: Three dogs dead after eating native tree's fruit
thread.title_full: Beware the karaka berry: Three dogs dead after eating native tree's fruit

title: Beware the karaka berry: Three dogs dead after eating native tree's fruit
text:
The kernels of their berries contain a neurotoxin and the powerful alkaloid poison karakin. 
Initial signs of karaka berry poisoning are nausea, diarrhoea and restlessness. 
These quickly progress to more severe gastrointestinal and neurological issues, including pacing, limb rigidity, crying, seizures and then unconsciousness. 
Owners whose dogs eat the berries need to take it "extremely seriously", Robson said. 
"Get to a vet clinic as fast as you possibly can." Ad Feedback 
While some dogs can be rescued, it becomes much harder once they start having seizure. 
Robson said serious cases need a specialist 24-hour care facility in order to fully recover, though many dogs still die even with "prompt and thorough veterinary attention." 
If you suspect your dog has ingested something toxic or poisonous, seek vet attention immediately, he said. - Stuff
